At this year's Amazon Academy event, Minister Mark Boris Andrijani? emphasized the importance of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) for Europe's success, as they create many jobs and great added value to the economy.

Minister of Digital Transformation Mark Boris Andrijani? said in the introduction that the majority of small and medium-sized enterprises are micro-enterprises with less than nine employees. As a result, these companies have much more limited access to state-of-the-art technologies, big data and digital skills compared to larger companies. In addition, the share of ICT professionals employed in small and medium-sized enterprises has been declining since 2015. "This is one of the reasons why the European Commission has presented a new European industrial strategy for 2020. According to this ambitious document, the digital and green transformation of small and medium-sized enterprises play a key role in Europe's future growth and resilience," he said.

He highlighted the encouraging state of EU programs and regulations supporting small and medium-sized enterprises. ?I am pleased that there are more and more private initiatives in this area. I am grateful to Amazon for taking the lead in this field with its excellent programs for small and medium-sized businesses, ?he added.

In his address, Andrijani? touched on the importance of efforts to support small and medium-sized enterprises, especially at a time when they were severely affected by the covida-19 pandemic: ?Our common responsibility is to help small and medium-sized enterprises recover and become stronger. ?

The Minister also commented on the progress of the Slovenian Presidency of the Council of the EU in regulations in the field of digital services and markets, artificial intelligence and data management. These and many other acts are intended to strengthen the role of European entrepreneurs and consumers. At the same time, he touched on a number of national and regional initiatives in support of small and medium-sized enterprises. ?We are implementing 40 ambitious measures that will accelerate the digital transformation of public administration, healthcare, business, education and society as a whole. We are steadily reducing bureaucracy and taxes for small and medium-sized enterprises, and next year we will start implementing the most comprehensive digital training program in the history of our country, which will benefit small and medium-sized enterprises and the elderly and other vulnerable groups, "he explained.

This year?s Amazon Academy 2021 event, which focused on incentives for SME success, brought together policy makers, NGOs and many other individuals with an interest in entrepreneurship and e-commerce.
